subtitle: The warm spiciness of the ginger in this marmalade offsets the sharpness of the grapefruit.

method.text: Peel the grapefruit and lemon, remove any excess pith. Cut the rind into fine shreds and place in a preserving pan or large saucepan. Squeeze the juice from the fruit and add to the pan, with any seeds and ginger tied up in a piece of muslin.

Add the water to the pan, bring to the boil then simmer for 1 hour or until fruit is tender. Remove the muslin bag, squeeze out any excess juice then stir the sugar into the pan. Simmer for 3-5 min stirring constantly until dissolved then bring to the boil, and when a full rolling boil has been reached, stir in the ginger.
Boil for at least a further 4 min, until setting point has been reached. Skim off any scum, leave to stand for 15 min, then stir gently. Pour into warmed sterilised jars, cover, seal and label.

title: Gingered grapefruit marmalade
